article: Travelling can be a fun way to gain life experiences, especially during Spring Break - a week long school vacation in the USA.  But What if you're a student and don't have enough money for a trip? Don't worry. Here are some _ .  Save: This probably is the most important preparation for travelling. _ expenses to fatten your wallet so you'll have _ choices about where to go and how to get there.  Plan ahead: Don't wait _ the last minute to plan your trip. Tickets may cost more when bought at short notice . Giving yourself several months to get ready can mean security and savings.  Do your homework: No matter _ you go, research the places you will visit. Decide what to see. Travel books will _ information on the cheapest hotels and restaurants.  Plan sensibly : Write down how much you expect to spend for food and hotels. Stick to your plan _ you may not have enough money to cover everything.  Travel in groups: Find someone who is interested in visiting the _ places. By travelling with others you can _ costs and experiences.   Work as you go: Need more money to support your trip? Look for work in the places you visit.  Go off the beaten path: Tourist cities may be expensive. You may want to rethink your trip and go to a _ known area. Smaller towns can have many interesting activities and sights.   Pack necessary things: The most important things to take are not always clothes. Remember to take along medicine in case you get sick and snacks in case you cannot find a cheap restaurant.  Use the Internet: The Net can help to save money. There are some useful websites such as www.tracelcity.com and www.economytravel.com.  _ planning sensibly, even students can enjoy their travel. Your travel experiences will be remembered for a lifetime.
